intro: Hibbertia cactifolia, commonly known as the cactus-flowered sandblush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually reduced to small, scale-like structures, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Hibbertia cactifolia is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
